(Associated Press) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Police were notified of the boy's disappearance at 7:30 a.m. by family members who said they woke to find him gone and the front door open. They said they'd last seen him in his bed Wednesday night. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Security camera video showed the boy, Elijah Marsh, leaving the building at about 4 a.m. After a massive search, he was found just after 10 a.m. in a nearby yard. He did not show any vital signs, and was rushed to the hospital. Police later announced his death on Twitter. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "You see the picture of that beautiful little boy with a nice smile and the video of the child going out into the cold," Toronto police chief Bill Blair said. "It really is a tragic set of circumstances."
